objects.name: allows the attackers to bypass the bank’s SMS-code verification challenge
tricks victims into fetching a mobile app from a fake Google Play page
sent to a fake Google Play page featuring a corresponding banking app logo of the banking brand the victim originally attempted to access
Check account balance on the victim’s bank account
Attempt to initiate a money transfer transaction
Send victim’s login information to attacker’s C2 server
Check if the infected machine is currently online
manipulate what victims see on their screens and have them click on elements
replace a login button from the original bank’s webpage and plant its own button that the victim will click
sends data to the C2 server, including authorization token, SMS content, telephone number and account login information
presents a maintenance notice on the account
receive two-factor authentication codes sent by banks
If the victims submit their phone number on the web injection, the remote server will send back a download URL for them to unknowingly download the Cerberus malware
Send data to C2: token, SMS content, telephone, download an application
